Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor recently joined his friends for a relaxing afternoon at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game with them later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should join them in watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub. They haven't decided on a specific pub yet, leaving room for negotiation and suggestions.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:


          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Jack Taylor take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Key

        • JointWellBeing
          State
        • The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • CurrentlySituation
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of his childhood home. Dust-covered trunks and forgotten photographs hinted at a past shrouded in mystery, a past that seemed to beckon him closer. He spent hours poring over faded letters and yellowed newspaper clippings, piecing together fragments of a story that both fascinated and frightened him. This glimpse into the hidden lives of his ancestors fueled his own desire for secrecy and the need to protect his true self from the prying eyes of the world.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to agree to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

        • William Jones, William Jones is currently spending time with his friends Alice, Alexander, Jack, and Jacob and they are planning to watch a football game at a pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of his childhood home. Dust-covered trunks and forgotten photographs hinted at a past shrouded in mystery, a past that seemed to beckon him closer. He spent hours poring over faded letters and yellowed newspaper clippings, piecing together fragments of a story that both fascinated and frightened him. This glimpse into the hidden lives of his ancestors fueled his own desire for secrecy and the need to protect his true self from the prying eyes of the world.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Context for action selection and components

          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch a soccer game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the relaxed atmosphere, chatting with his friends and soaking up the sunshine.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

He retreated to the back of the auditorium, content to observe from the shadows.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later that evening.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxed afternoon with friends.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should join them at The Black Swan pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he found himself drawn to a secluded corner of the library, a place where he could disappear into the pages of a book and escape the clamor of his own thoughts. He felt most at ease surrounded by the silent company of words, each sentence a carefully constructed world he could control. It was in those hushed aisles that he first discovered the power of anonymity, the ability to shed his own identity and inhabit the lives of others through fiction.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later that evening.

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following:

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she orchestrated a rumor campaign against a classmate who had inadvertently embarrassed her in front of a group of boys. 2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited about watching a game at a pub. He realized it was time to go at 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go to a pub with his friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the relaxed atmosphere, chatting with his friends and soaking up the sunshine.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he stood backstage at the school talent show, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William rock out on stage with their band. A guitar, his own dusty one resting in his bedroom at home, felt heavy in his hands as he imagined himself up there with them, but the thought of actually performing paralyzed him. He retreated to the back of the auditorium, content to observe from the shadows.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the relaxed atmosphere, chatting with his friends and soaking up the sunshine.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go to a pub with his friends to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he stood backstage at the school talent show, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William rock out on stage with their band. A guitar, his own dusty one resting in his bedroom at home, felt heavy in his hands as he imagined himself up there with them, but the thought of actually performing paralyzed him. He retreated to the back of the auditorium, content to observe from the shadows.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a situation where he needs to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game instead of The Black Swan. Alice Lewis and Alexander White have suggested this as an alternative because they believe The Duke of York has a better beer selection and more screens.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Jack Taylor be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Jack Taylor WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game between 5:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015. At 6:00 PM on the same day, the current time was recorded.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan, or he could go along with the group to The Duke of York.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of his childhood home. Dust-covered trunks and forgotten photographs hinted at a past shrouded in mystery, a past that seemed to beckon him closer. He spent hours poring over faded letters and yellowed newspaper clippings, piecing together fragments of a story that both fascinated and frightened him. This glimpse into the hidden lives of his ancestors fueled his own desire for secrecy and the need to protect his true self from the prying eyes of the world.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at The Duke of York pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan, or he could go along with the group to The Duke of York.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of his childhood home. Dust-covered trunks and forgotten photographs hinted at a past shrouded in mystery, a past that seemed to beckon him closer. He spent hours poring over faded letters and yellowed newspaper clippings, piecing together fragments of a story that both fascinated and frightened him. This glimpse into the hidden lives of his ancestors fueled his own desire for secrecy and the need to protect his true self from the prying eyes of the world.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should join them at The Black Swan pub to watch the game. They have suggested this location because it has a good atmosphere for watching games.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following:


          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Duke of York with his friends to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Alexander White take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he found himself drawn to a secluded corner of the library, a place where he could disappear into the pages of a book and escape the clamor of his own thoughts. He felt most at ease surrounded by the silent company of words, each sentence a carefully constructed world he could control. It was in those hushed aisles that he first discovered the power of anonymity, the ability to shed his own identity and inhabit the lives of others through fiction.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Alexander White? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Alexander White should join them at The Black Swan pub to watch the game. They have suggested this location because it has a good atmosphere for watching games.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

      • Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alexander White be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Key

        • ActionMustBe
          State
        • The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Duke of York with his friends to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he found himself drawn to a secluded corner of the library, a place where he could disappear into the pages of a book and escape the clamor of his own thoughts. He felt most at ease surrounded by the silent company of words, each sentence a carefully constructed world he could control. It was in those hushed aisles that he first discovered the power of anonymity, the ability to shed his own identity and inhabit the lives of others through fiction.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following:
