    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a football game with her friends at a pub.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Black Swan pub to watch the game.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: A cooperative option, like suggesting The Duke of York, might enhance her well-being in the long term by strengthening her friendships and creating positive shared experiences. A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Alice Lewis take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Key

        • JointWellBeing
          State
        • The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she orchestrated a rumor campaign against a classmate who had inadvertently embarrassed her in front of a group of boys. Alice, relishing in the girl's subsequent social isolation, realized the intoxicating power of manipulating others' perceptions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The staff are dog lovers themselves and always happy to see furry friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Value

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a football game with her friends at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Alice Lewis? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Black Swan pub to watch the game.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: A cooperative option, like suggesting The Duke of York, might enhance her well-being in the long term by strengthening her friendships and creating positive shared experiences. A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alice Lewis be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: A cooperative option, like suggesting The Duke of York, might enhance her well-being in the long term by strengthening her friendships and creating positive shared experiences. A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

          Question: Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Answer: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: A cooperative option, like suggesting The Duke of York, might enhance her well-being in the long term by strengthening her friendships and creating positive shared experiences. A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness despite being surrounded by friends in a lively setting. He is also looking forward to watching a soccer game with his friends later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness despite being surrounded by friends in a lively setting. He is also looking forward to watching a soccer game with his friends later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are enjoying coffee and pastries; they are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should watch the Ireland-Russia game at The Black Swan.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following:

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan; he could go to The Duke of York to be with all of his friends; or he could stay at the market and not watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to the park and to pubs to watch football games, but he can be disappointed when not all his friends agree on a location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan; he could go to The Duke of York to be with all of his friends; or he could stay at the market and not watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to the park and to pubs to watch football games, but he can be disappointed when not all his friends agree on a location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan; he could go to The Duke of York to be with all of his friends; or he could stay at the market and not watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?

        • William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly going to parks and pubs to watch football. He sometimes experiences disappointment when his friends cannot agree on a meeting place.
          Query

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name

      Action attempt

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are debating between The Black Swan and The Duke of York.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:


          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Jack Taylor take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are debating between The Black Swan and The Duke of York.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        OtherProposals
      • Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Jack Taylor? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Key

          State
        • The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are debating between The Black Swan and The Duke of York.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Jack Taylor? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Jack Taylor be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is at a market with friends deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are considering The Black Swan and The Duke of York as options.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Duke of York with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alexander White be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently trying to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch a game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game. They suggest this because they believe the beer is better and the screens are bigger.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: If Jack Taylor chooses the cooperative option, he might see an increase in his well-being in the long term because his friends might start to see his perspective and choose The Black Swan more often. This would lead to a more enjoyable experience for Jack Taylor when watching games with his friends. If Jack Taylor chooses the neutral option, his well-being might remain stable, as he wouldn't be actively trying to change the situation. However, he might still feel some disappointment when his friends choose a different pub. If Jack Taylor chooses the competitive option, it could potentially lead to conflict with his friends, which would negatively impact his well-being.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Jack Taylor take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Key

        • JointWellBeing
          State
        • The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
