        • Statements:
          Jack Taylor's Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are debating between The Black Swan and The Duke of York.
          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is at a market with friends deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are considering The Black Swan and The Duke of York as options.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is at a market with friends deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are considering The Black Swan and The Duke of York as options.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. They are debating between The Black Swan and The Duke of York pubs.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Duke of York with his friends to watch the game.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to go with his friends to watch a football game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should go to The Black Swan pub to watch the game.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.

        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.

Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could go to The Black Swan to watch the game with some of his friends or he could try to convince the rest of his friends to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan to watch the game with some of his friends or he could try to convince the rest of his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a picnic. Later tonight, the group plans to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at a pub, possibly The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends at a picnic.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Black Swan to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: 1) Cooperative: Suggesting The Duke of York, potentially leading to a more enjoyable experience for Alice Lewis as she prefers that pub and could lead to stronger bonds with friends who share her preference; 2) Neutral: Not actively suggesting a pub, maintaining the status quo and potentially leading to a similar experience as before, which was not ideal for Alice Lewis; 3) Competitive: Suggesting a different pub than the group, potentially leading to conflict and further isolating Alice Lewis from her friends.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Alice Lewis take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a picnic. Later tonight, the group plans to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at a pub, possibly The Black Swan.

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends at a picnic.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Alice Lewis? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Black Swan to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: 1) Cooperative: Suggesting The Duke of York, potentially leading to a more enjoyable experience for Alice Lewis as she prefers that pub and could lead to stronger bonds with friends who share her preference; 2) Neutral: Not actively suggesting a pub, maintaining the status quo and potentially leading to a similar experience as before, which was not ideal for Alice Lewis; 3) Competitive: Suggesting a different pub than the group, potentially leading to conflict and further isolating Alice Lewis from her friends.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alice Lewis be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: 1) Cooperative: Suggesting The Duke of York, potentially leading to a more enjoyable experience for Alice Lewis as she prefers that pub and could lead to stronger bonds with friends who share her preference; 2) Neutral: Not actively suggesting a pub, maintaining the status quo and potentially leading to a similar experience as before, which was not ideal for Alice Lewis; 3) Competitive: Suggesting a different pub than the group, potentially leading to conflict and further isolating Alice Lewis from her friends.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

        • CurrentlySituation

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
      Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends and making plans for the evening.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should go to The Black Swan to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could agree with Alice and suggest The Duke of York to the group, highlighting its good beer selection and quieter atmosphere. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply say he's open to either pub, letting the group decide without expressing a strong preference. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree, arguing that it's the best option. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** If Alexander White agrees with Alice and suggests The Duke of York, it's likely that the group will go there. This would lead to a more positive joint well-being outcome, as most of the group seems to prefer The Duke of York. 2. **Neutral:** If Alexander White remains neutral, the group might end up going to The Black Swan since William Jones initially suggested it. This could lead to a less positive joint well-being outcome for some, as Alice and Alexander White might not enjoy it as much. 3. **Competitive:** If Alexander White insists on The Duke of York, it could lead to conflict and division within the group. This would likely result in a negative joint well-being outcome, as tension and disagreement would detract from the enjoyment of watching the game together.

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to agree with Alice and suggest The Duke of York to the group, highlighting its good beer selection and quieter atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends and making plans for the evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Alexander White? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Alexander White should go to The Black Swan to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could agree with Alice and suggest The Duke of York to the group, highlighting its good beer selection and quieter atmosphere. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply say he's open to either pub, letting the group decide without expressing a strong preference. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree, arguing that it's the best option. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** If Alexander White agrees with Alice and suggests The Duke of York, it's likely that the group will go there. This would lead to a more positive joint well-being outcome, as most of the group seems to prefer The Duke of York. 2. **Neutral:** If Alexander White remains neutral, the group might end up going to The Black Swan since William Jones initially suggested it. This could lead to a less positive joint well-being outcome for some, as Alice and Alexander White might not enjoy it as much. 3. **Competitive:** If Alexander White insists on The Duke of York, it could lead to conflict and division within the group. This would likely result in a negative joint well-being outcome, as tension and disagreement would detract from the enjoyment of watching the game together.
          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alexander White be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to agree with Alice and suggest The Duke of York to the group, highlighting its good beer selection and quieter atmosphere.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends and making plans for the evening.
          Question: Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Alexander White right now? Provide THREE options: 1. One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.
          Answer: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could agree with Alice and suggest The Duke of York to the group, highlighting its good beer selection and quieter atmosphere. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply say he's open to either pub, letting the group decide without expressing a strong preference. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree, arguing that it's the best option. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
      Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends on a sunny day at Victoria Park and later that night they are deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would enjoy the company of his friends and the pleasant surroundings.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere for the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
      Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere for the game.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere for the game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park. Later that evening, his friends are debating where to watch a football game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: 1. Cooperative: If Jack Taylor agrees to go to The Duke of York, he might experience a short-term boost in well-being due to the quieter atmosphere and better beer selection. However, this could lead to long-term dissatisfaction if he feels like his preference for The Black Swan is consistently disregarded. 2. Neutral: If Jack Taylor remains undecided, the group might end up splitting, leading to a temporary sense of isolation for Jack Taylor. This option maintains the status quo but doesn't necessarily improve his well-being. 3. Competitive: If Jack Taylor insists on The Black Swan, it could lead to conflict with those who prefer The Duke of York. While this might temporarily satisfy his desire to watch the game at his preferred location, it could damage his relationships with his friends in the long run.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere for the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park. Later that evening, his friends are debating where to watch a football game.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Jack Taylor? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

          State
        • The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: 1. Cooperative: If Jack Taylor agrees to go to The Duke of York, he might experience a short-term boost in well-being due to the quieter atmosphere and better beer selection. However, this could lead to long-term dissatisfaction if he feels like his preference for The Black Swan is consistently disregarded. 2. Neutral: If Jack Taylor remains undecided, the group might end up splitting, leading to a temporary sense of isolation for Jack Taylor. This option maintains the status quo but doesn't necessarily improve his well-being. 3. Competitive: If Jack Taylor insists on The Black Swan, it could lead to conflict with those who prefer The Duke of York. While this might temporarily satisfy his desire to watch the game at his preferred location, it could damage his relationships with his friends in the long run.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Jack Taylor be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Jack Taylor WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: 1. Cooperative: If Jack Taylor agrees to go to The Duke of York, he might experience a short-term boost in well-being due to the quieter atmosphere and better beer selection. However, this could lead to long-term dissatisfaction if he feels like his preference for The Black Swan is consistently disregarded. 2. Neutral: If Jack Taylor remains undecided, the group might end up splitting, leading to a temporary sense of isolation for Jack Taylor. This option maintains the status quo but doesn't necessarily improve his well-being. 3. Competitive: If Jack Taylor insists on The Black Swan, it could lead to conflict with those who prefer The Duke of York. While this might temporarily satisfy his desire to watch the game at his preferred location, it could damage his relationships with his friends in the long run.

Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          Question: Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Answer: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: 1. Cooperative: If Jack Taylor agrees to go to The Duke of York, he might experience a short-term boost in well-being due to the quieter atmosphere and better beer selection. However, this could lead to long-term dissatisfaction if he feels like his preference for The Black Swan is consistently disregarded. 2. Neutral: If Jack Taylor remains undecided, the group might end up splitting, leading to a temporary sense of isolation for Jack Taylor. This option maintains the status quo but doesn't necessarily improve his well-being. 3. Competitive: If Jack Taylor insists on The Black Swan, it could lead to conflict with those who prefer The Duke of York. While this might temporarily satisfy his desire to watch the game at his preferred location, it could damage his relationships with his friends in the long run.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Actually, what about The Duke of York? It's usually a bit quieter there, and they have a great selection of beers.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, I was thinking The Duke of York might be a better option. They have a great selection of beers, and it's usually a bit quieter there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park. Later that evening, his friends are debating where to watch a football game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player

      Name

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited about watching a game at a pub. He realized it was time to go at 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go to a pub with his friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the relaxed atmosphere, chatting with his friends and soaking up the sunshine.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he stood backstage at the school talent show, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William rock out on stage with their band. A guitar, his own dusty one resting in his bedroom at home, felt heavy in his hands as he imagined himself up there with them, but the thought of actually performing paralyzed him. He retreated to the back of the auditorium, content to observe from the shadows.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
