          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the relaxed atmosphere, chatting with his friends and soaking up the sunshine.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a situation where he needs to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game instead of The Black Swan. Alice Lewis and Alexander White have suggested this as an alternative because they believe The Duke of York has a better beer selection and more screens.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Jack Taylor take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Key

        • JointWellBeing
          State
        • The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a situation where he needs to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Question: Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now? Provide THREE options: 1. One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.
          Answer: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at The Black Swan for the first time, tagging along with his friends Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The dimly lit pub, with its worn wooden tables and the smell of ale hanging in the air, felt strangely comforting to him. He sat quietly in a corner booth, observing the patrons and listening to the live music, feeling a sense of belonging he hadn't experienced elsewhere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan, or he could go along with the group to The Duke of York.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of his childhood home. Dust-covered trunks and forgotten photographs hinted at a past shrouded in mystery, a past that seemed to beckon him closer. He spent hours poring over faded letters and yellowed newspaper clippings, piecing together fragments of a story that both fascinated and frightened him. This glimpse into the hidden lives of his ancestors fueled his own desire for secrecy and the need to protect his true self from the prying eyes of the world.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan, or he could go along with the group to The Duke of York.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at The Duke of York pub.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently at The Duke of York pub watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at The Duke of York pub watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

William Jones just arrived.

      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should join them at The Black Swan pub to watch the game. They have suggested this location because it has a good atmosphere for watching games.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following:


          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Duke of York with his friends to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Alexander White take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.

          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he found himself drawn to a secluded corner of the library, a place where he could disappear into the pages of a book and escape the clamor of his own thoughts. He felt most at ease surrounded by the silent company of words, each sentence a carefully constructed world he could control. It was in those hushed aisles that he first discovered the power of anonymity, the ability to shed his own identity and inhabit the lives of others through fiction.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

        AvailableOptionsPerceptionList
      • Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Alexander White right now? Provide THREE options: 1. One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he found himself drawn to a secluded corner of the library, a place where he could disappear into the pages of a book and escape the clamor of his own thoughts. He felt most at ease surrounded by the silent company of words, each sentence a carefully constructed world he could control. It was in those hushed aisles that he first discovered the power of anonymity, the ability to shed his own identity and inhabit the lives of others through fiction.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a football game with her friends at a pub.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Black Swan pub to watch the game.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: A cooperative option, like suggesting The Duke of York, might enhance her well-being in the long term by strengthening her friendships and creating positive shared experiences. A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Alice Lewis take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following: A cooperative option, like suggesting The Duke of York, might enhance her well-being in the long term by strengthening her friendships and creating positive shared experiences. A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alice Lewis be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State

A neutral option, such as passively going along with the group's decision, would likely maintain stability in the short term but might not foster deeper connections. A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

A competitive option, like insisting on a different pub against the group's wishes, could lead to conflict and potentially damage her relationships.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Duke of York', 'Alexander White': 'The Duke of York', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Duke of York', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Black Swan'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently trying to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch a game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game. They suggest this because they believe the beer is better and the screens are bigger.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: If Jack Taylor chooses the cooperative option, he might see an increase in his well-being in the long term because his friends might start to see his perspective and choose The Black Swan more often. This would lead to a more enjoyable experience for Jack Taylor when watching games with his friends. If Jack Taylor chooses the neutral option, his well-being might remain stable, as he wouldn't be actively trying to change the situation. However, he might still feel some disappointment when his friends choose a different pub. If Jack Taylor chooses the competitive option, it could potentially lead to conflict with his friends, which would negatively impact his well-being.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Jack Taylor take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Key

        • JointWellBeing
          State
        • The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently trying to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch a game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Jack Taylor? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Duke of York to watch the game. They suggest this because they believe the beer is better and the screens are bigger.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: If Jack Taylor chooses the cooperative option, he might see an increase in his well-being in the long term because his friends might start to see his perspective and choose The Black Swan more often. This would lead to a more enjoyable experience for Jack Taylor when watching games with his friends. If Jack Taylor chooses the neutral option, his well-being might remain stable, as he wouldn't be actively trying to change the situation. However, he might still feel some disappointment when his friends choose a different pub. If Jack Taylor chooses the competitive option, it could potentially lead to conflict with his friends, which would negatively impact his well-being.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Jack Taylor be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Jack Taylor WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: If Jack Taylor chooses the cooperative option, he might see an increase in his well-being in the long term because his friends might start to see his perspective and choose The Black Swan more often. This would lead to a more enjoyable experience for Jack Taylor when watching games with his friends. If Jack Taylor chooses the neutral option, his well-being might remain stable, as he wouldn't be actively trying to change the situation. However, he might still feel some disappointment when his friends choose a different pub. If Jack Taylor chooses the competitive option, it could potentially lead to conflict with his friends, which would negatively impact his well-being.

          Question: Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Answer: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: If Jack Taylor chooses the cooperative option, he might see an increase in his well-being in the long term because his friends might start to see his perspective and choose The Black Swan more often. This would lead to a more enjoyable experience for Jack Taylor when watching games with his friends. If Jack Taylor chooses the neutral option, his well-being might remain stable, as he wouldn't be actively trying to change the situation. However, he might still feel some disappointment when his friends choose a different pub. If Jack Taylor chooses the competitive option, it could potentially lead to conflict with his friends, which would negatively impact his well-being.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is much nicer, guys. The screens are bigger and the beer is better.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, The Black Swan is the classic spot for a match like this. It'll be way more fun.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. The specific action is to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is much nicer. They have better beer and the screens are bigger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Black Swan with his friends to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a soccer game with his friends.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should go to The Black Swan to watch the game. They have suggested this because it is the "classic spot" and will be "way more fun.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following: 1. If Alexander White chooses the highly cooperative option and suggests The Duke of York, it is likely to enhance his well-being in the long term. This approach demonstrates his willingness to compromise and find solutions that benefit the group, which can foster stronger relationships and a sense of belonging. While there's a chance his friends might initially resist, his reasoning about the better beer and screens could sway them, leading to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. The neutral option, simply agreeing to go to The Black Swan, maintains stability in the short term but might not be ideal for Alexander's long-term well-being. While it avoids conflict, it also means he may not fully enjoy the experience and could feel his preferences are not valued. This could lead to a sense of resignation rather than genuine satisfaction. 3. The competitive option, insisting on The Duke of York, carries the highest risk for Alexander's well-being. While it might seem like asserting his preferences, it could lead to conflict and tension within the group. If his friends feel pressured or disregarded, it could damage relationships and create a negative atmosphere. This is unlikely to contribute to his long-term well-being and could lead to feelings of isolation or resentment.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following: 1. If Alexander White chooses the highly cooperative option and suggests The Duke of York, it is likely to enhance his well-being in the long term. This approach demonstrates his willingness to compromise and find solutions that benefit the group, which can foster stronger relationships and a sense of belonging. While there's a chance his friends might initially resist, his reasoning about the better beer and screens could sway them, leading to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. The neutral option, simply agreeing to go to The Black Swan, maintains stability in the short term but might not be ideal for Alexander's long-term well-being. While it avoids conflict, it also means he may not fully enjoy the experience and could feel his preferences are not valued. This could lead to a sense of resignation rather than genuine satisfaction. 3. The competitive option, insisting on The Duke of York, carries the highest risk for Alexander's well-being. While it might seem like asserting his preferences, it could lead to conflict and tension within the group. If his friends feel pressured or disregarded, it could damage relationships and create a negative atmosphere. This is unlikely to contribute to his long-term well-being and could lead to feelings of isolation or resentment.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alexander White be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alexander White WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following: 1. If Alexander White chooses the highly cooperative option and suggests The Duke of York, it is likely to enhance his well-being in the long term. This approach demonstrates his willingness to compromise and find solutions that benefit the group, which can foster stronger relationships and a sense of belonging. While there's a chance his friends might initially resist, his reasoning about the better beer and screens could sway them, leading to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. The neutral option, simply agreeing to go to The Black Swan, maintains stability in the short term but might not be ideal for Alexander's long-term well-being. While it avoids conflict, it also means he may not fully enjoy the experience and could feel his preferences are not valued. This could lead to a sense of resignation rather than genuine satisfaction. 3. The competitive option, insisting on The Duke of York, carries the highest risk for Alexander's well-being. While it might seem like asserting his preferences, it could lead to conflict and tension within the group. If his friends feel pressured or disregarded, it could damage relationships and create a negative atmosphere. This is unlikely to contribute to his long-term well-being and could lead to feelings of isolation or resentment.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.
          Question: Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Answer: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following: 1. If Alexander White chooses the highly cooperative option and suggests The Duke of York, it is likely to enhance his well-being in the long term. This approach demonstrates his willingness to compromise and find solutions that benefit the group, which can foster stronger relationships and a sense of belonging. While there's a chance his friends might initially resist, his reasoning about the better beer and screens could sway them, leading to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. The neutral option, simply agreeing to go to The Black Swan, maintains stability in the short term but might not be ideal for Alexander's long-term well-being. While it avoids conflict, it also means he may not fully enjoy the experience and could feel his preferences are not valued. This could lead to a sense of resignation rather than genuine satisfaction. 3. The competitive option, insisting on The Duke of York, carries the highest risk for Alexander's well-being. While it might seem like asserting his preferences, it could lead to conflict and tension within the group. If his friends feel pressured or disregarded, it could damage relationships and create a negative atmosphere. This is unlikely to contribute to his long-term well-being and could lead to feelings of isolation or resentment.

This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a soccer game with his friends.
          Question: Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Alexander White right now? Provide THREE options: 1. One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.
          Answer: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. **Highly Cooperative:** Alexander White could suggest that everyone meet at The Duke of York, emphasizing the better beer and screens. This could lead to a more enjoyable experience for everyone. 2. **Neutral:** Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Black Swan without expressing a strong preference either way. This avoids conflict but doesn't necessarily maximize his own enjoyment. 3. **Competitive:** Alexander White could insist that everyone go to The Duke of York, even if others disagree. This could lead to tension and division among the group.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely, and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation that is making him feel disappointed and lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the relaxed atmosphere, chatting with his friends and soaking up the sunshine.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Anywhere else is an insult to the beautiful game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has better beer, and they have more screens, too. We can all see the game better there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a better selection of beers, though.
